Rowena is a dedicated aspiring fashion journalist hoping to transfer from De Anza College to Rutgers University in Fall 2016.        Skills    Graphic Designer, posters
story:
Let me craft Rowena's professional journey as a story:

Rowena's professional journey began in 2002 when she took her first role as a salesperson, where she spent two years honing her customer service and communication skills. In 2006, she gained valuable exposure to the corporate world through an internship as a Human Resource Manager, which helped her understand the intricacies of workplace dynamics.

After completing her education at Holy Innocents' High School in Singapore in 2010, Rowena pursued her passion for journalism at De Anza College. During her college years, she discovered her creative side and stepped into the world of graphic design. From January 2014 to January 2015, she worked as a Graphic Designer, and her talent led her to serve as a Club Officer in Fall 2014, where she created eye-catching event posters not only for her own club but for various campus organizations as well.

A dedicated professional with a creative eye, Rowena combines her design skills with her journalism background. As of 2015, she was working toward her next goal: transferring to Rutgers University to further her dream of becoming a fashion journalist.

This story showcases Rowena's diverse experience across sales, human resources, and graphic design, while highlighting her educational journey from Singapore to the United States and her clear career aspirations in fashion journalism.
